Groton Memorial Town Forest

Highlights

Views of Nashua River, Mountain Biking

Activities

Swimming, Fishing, Getting Lost, Hiking, Mountain Biking, Equestrian, Cross Country Skiing, Snowshoeing

Please take personal protection measures to reduce your exposure to ticks and mosquito bites.

Parking

Town Forest Road, Groton MA
Google Maps, Apple Maps

Hours

Sunrise to Sunset. Sunrise Time , Sunset Time

Size

524.0 Acres, Trails 13.5 miles, 21.7 km

Property Owner

Groton Town Forest Committee

Links

NEMBA Groton Town Forest
Groton Town Forest Race
Town Forest Committee

Trail Maintenance

Countless volunteers and the Groton Trails Committee. Please email gtc@grotontrails.org to report problems or offer to help.

Description

The Town Forest is owned by the town of Groton and is managed by the Town Forest Committee. The Town Forest is one of the more popular places in Groton to enjoy the outdoors. It offers plenty of space to explore and beautiful views of the Nashua River. The site has a large variety of trails that are excellent for leisurely strolls, mounting biking, horse back riding, dog walking, and nature watching. It is also the site of the annual Groton Town Forest Race.

The parking lot at the end of town forest road has ample space as well as a turning circle for horse trailers.

Trails

10 mile loop trail, Dead river Road trail.

History

The Groton Memorial Town Forest was established in 1922 as a memorial to the men who gave their lives in World War I.
